main event: Several military and civilian observers saw unidentified objects in the sky that appeared to be subjected to air interception in Salamanca, New York in 1958.
interesting points: The objects were maneuverable and seemed to touch each other, leading to intense conjecture.
A letter from a witness claims to have seen thousands of silver-colored objects in the sky, and some of these were collected and sent for examination.
The witnesses reported feeling a tingling sensation in their hands after touching the collected objects.
Spectrographic analysis showed the objects to be radar chaff similar to 543 and 543A, with a radar signature typical of chaff.
The photographic examination of the material furnished with a letter confirmed the objects to be radar chaff.
witnesses: several military and civilian observers, as well as a witness from the general public
